title: 106_s986
content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act defines the "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized by the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired by the United States for the Griffith Project. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under Federal ownership managed by the Bureau of Land Management. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands withdrawn from settlement, sale, or mineral location. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved for a specific public purpose under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, and acquired lands to the Authority. The Authority will take over the Griffith Project from the United States by paying $121,204,348. The Authority will receive all rights to project improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests in patented lands. Additionally, the Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Federal lands for the operation, maintenance, replacement, and repair of the Griffith Project without payment of rental fees. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority must agree on the land description and memorialize the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority can modify existing contracts and permits to comply with this Act. This Act also addresses the relationship with other laws and future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it shall no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will not be affected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will remain unaffected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, the United States will not be liable for any damages related to its prior ownership of the conveyed property.
